reviewText:
You know it's coming - but when homicide hits in this movie, it comes with the speed of a rattlesnake strike. It's swifter than the eye can capture, and it's more sinister than any thuggish attack could ever be.

After a shocker of an opening sequence, the movie proceeds at a slower pace for a while. We see the very socially awkward and involute Bess yearning after the handsome jock in her school. The tension builds as we wonder how far her obsession has taken her in the past and is taking her in the present. Almost everyone is suspect though.

This is a good effort at a psychological thriller. The protagonists really talk with each other - or at least exchange more telling texts. So we get to know them better than we do in the average thriller that's being cranked out. Their motivations aren't always very clear or consistent, and the writers perhaps did some reaching for a different, interesting resolution. But I think you'll find this movie worth your time.

One warning: Don't look too closely at the jacket of the DVD, so no part of the ending will be revealed to you.

The film centers around Bess (Crystal Reed) and her crush on Scott (Lucas Till). Bess is the socially awkward new kid. She seemingly lives alone in a house while working at a book store. Scott has looks, brains, and athletic ability. All the girls drool over him. Jules (Sarah Bolger) is his girlfriend who he breaks up with because he needs to concentrate. (Seriously, can you believe a guy wrote this?)

Other people include teammate Casey (Preston Davis) who believes Scott is a ball hog. Scott's dad is protective and is always going out to work. And Jeffrey (Reid Ewing) has a crush on Bess. Their relationship is encouraged by an older woman and confidant (Meredith Salenger) who works at the bookshop.

Accidents happen to people around Scott. We get to see the arm or hand of the person who is revealed to us about an hour into the film when our fairly decent mystery turns into "Misery."

I couldn't help think that the song "Love Stinks" would have made a good title track had they made this film 30 years ago...before the target audience existed. The film covers the many aspect of teen angst as we see it cross the line from "cute to creepy." As part of the older crowd, I had to laugh when two teens standing on opposites sides of a glass door opt to have a conversation by texting. Open your mouths!

At one point Scott finds a note in his locker. The movie didn't give me tie to read it. I had to pause the film.

I like quirky crush films where we know who the killer is and see the odd if not comical things she does. This isn't that film and it would have worked better my way. This is a film for those girls whose first crush still weighs heavy.

Parental Guide: 1 F-bomb. No nudity. Making out on bed.

I hate when old men review teen films and have no clue what it means to have fun with a few friends by watching a great movie like Crush.  This was better than most thriller films I've watched in theaters.  Very subtle creepiness builds until the finale -- and you'll never see the twist coming.  Really cool, I think you'll enjoy.
BTW - not sure why they give things away with the dvd cover -- someone didn't think about that one:(
A little predictable, but still a fun watch.
Was ok
Great movie! Well written with some very fine acting. But Sarah Bolger ... 'Nuff said. She's just an awesome young actress. I'm a huge fan.
Immensely fun and creepy movie, brings back all the emotional highs and lows of high school - and puts a creepy twist on it. Good ending.

I wasn't expecting much when I rented this movie, but I do like some of the actors in it.  What I did see was a fantastic movie with a great plot twist.  I am really surprised this movie does not have a wider following.  I like the actress from Outlander, and she did a great job in this flick.  Even the Old Spice dude is in it.  What more can I say!!! This will become a cult classic, and the beginning when the young boy kisses the "wrong girl" will move you to the edge of your seat, and keep you there in suspense throughout.  Enjoy this one.
BEST MOVIE
Odd, good twist, but the twist was never really explained just kind of random like they edited out a little too much. Wouldn't recommend.
Crystal Reed needs to do more movies!!

I wasn't expecting much from this movie, but I'm a sucker for a stalker flick. And as a plus it has Lucas Hill from X-men in it. I mainly rented because I like him as a actor. However, I was pleasantly surprised by this film and the surprise ending. I saw something similar coming, but still, they wrapped it up nicely. Worth the rent and later purchase.

The movie was fairly interesting and a cut-above-average than the usual suspense film these days right up until the last part. The protagonist was portrayed sympathetically and, surprisingly, it was a man in distress.  However, the circumstances in which the culprit was revealed led to a rather stereotypical ending.  It's hard to imagine how it might have been executed better at the end. Then, again, it is easier to be a critic than a film writer or director. It might have been nicer to provide even more depth to the characters, pparticularly the protagonist, his father, girlfriend, admirer, and, of course, the ultimate culprit.

After the first few minutes of the movie, I thought I knew how things were going to play out. That was not the case at all. There are some twists in this movie but it doesn't make it any more satisfying to watch. I really wanted to like this movie because Crystal Reed was in it but it was only mildly OK.

This is a good psychological movie. The one that you think has nothing to do with all the crimes are always the suspect. Its doppelgnger. Its tricky because they have the same look except the age differences (look at alone the movie poster). I always thought movie like this always happened all the time; One of the reason we had so many missing person these days. Obsession is very creepy. I would rather be obsess with my cats than to be obsess with a person. You will never going to be happy as long as you kept on holding to one person that will NEVER be yours. Learned to let go and let them be happy. You'll find someone that is meant for you.
Awesome flick! Watch this one!
I frigging loved it!!!Very good performance by Crystal Reed, she is going to be big someday. Suspenseful, yet mature. I say it is a bullseye. Just when you know, you realize you had no clue.
good
I am a Sarah Bolger Fan admittedly, but this was an all around good twisty-turny movie!
Not that good
I like it.
Awesome

I am not in the teenage bracket so I gave an extra star for that.  I watched it with my daughter though and she was bored.  One of my all time favorite movies is Fatal Attraction WHICH IS WAY BETTER THAN THIS FILM!! This film copied greatly from that Kathy Bates movie Misery.  The problem more than anything else is that the film was boring.  If it were exciting it wouldn't even matter how silly it was concocted.  The girl you think at first will be the psycho but isn't reminded me of Jodi Arias, she was really good in her role but just couldn't save this film from going down.  Admittedly it was so dull and I watched it after been up too many hours so I kind of went in "half sleep orbit" after the "big twist I read about in other reviews" which was still dull but would never be inspired to watch this disaster again.  If you want to watch a really great thriller of this genre I suggest BASIC INSTINCT OR FATAL ATTRACTION.  I purchased this off other reviews that spoke to how great this was so I went in with an wide open mind but perhaps too high of expectations.  All this being said though I still think somebody sixteen or seventeen would like it; the guy everybody was hot for was great looking.
great plot, kept me on the edge of my seat. would recommend to others. Suspenseful and kept me guessing. Worth watching.
I got it and watched it twice then thought that was enough, did not turn out the way i expected it to

BUT TO ME WAY BETTER THEN THE OTHER CRUSH MOVIE. THE GIRLS ARE HOTTER AND THE STALKER IS SUPER CUTE AND WAY MORE TWISTED. MY FAVORITE PART ABOUT THE STALKER IS HER FACIAL EXPRESSIONS AND MOODS.
AWESOME ACTRESS.

If you enjoyed this review, check out my horror film blog at: brandoncsites.blogspot.com

Crush (2013) *1/2 / 4
D: Malik Bader
C: Lucas Till, Crystal Reed, Sarah Bolger, Meredith Salenger, Caitriona Balfe, Reid Ewing, Leigh Whannell, Holt McCallany, Camille Guaty
P: A star athlete becomes the object of obsession for a secret admirer who's willing to do anything, including murder, to eliminate to the competition.

Fatal Attraction light for the teenage demographic. Crush is one of those films that I can easily imagine a bunch of teenage girls watching while at a slumber party.

Lucas Till is dreamy. Crystal Reed is angsty. There's a few false scares throughout, but nothing too terribly suspenseful. The dialogue, the interactions between the characters and the overall characterizations have been simplified for its target audience. Ohhhh .....and there's a twist.

Surprisingly though, Crush is well made and well acted. A lot better made and acted then the genre requires of it. However, it's too mild mannered in its approach. It's unimaginative and an unnecessary addition to the genre. It's teen audience will, at the least, find Crush watchable, but that's because they really don't know any better. Horror & thriller aficionados will be bored as Crush is just another relentlessly lackluster example of the genre, the type of PG-13 type dreck that fans bemoan about online. [PG-13] 94 mins.

I enjoyed this movie. I know people bash on it a lot, but sometimes you have to accept movies for what they are. This movie was meant to me a teen thriller, an adolescent version of fatal attraction so to speak. Sure the film does not have the best acting, the plot has been done before, and the film is a bit predictable, but I did not expect this movie to be oscar worthy or change my life. I expected it to be a teeny-bopper thriller. And that's what I got. Not the best movie but not a waste of time.

CRUSH is slow-moving, virtually humorless, without a lot of serious tension or big turnabouts, and a bit hard to follow. A lot of people obviously like the twist at the end, but all I can say is that it didn't surprise me that much. Nevertheless, the ending IS a lot more effective and conclusive than many of them. CRUSH is also realistically filmed and acted and gives a convincing view of the darker aspects of adolescence, capturing its angst, jealousy, loneliness, and love hexagrams very well. The way the girls in the film all look sort of alike is initially confusing but really serves its purpose in the end. All things considered, CRUSH is like a fairly good Lifetime film on PCP.

Everything in this movie seems to set up for just another good movie, describing a shy, sweet girl's descent into madness and obsession. Except there's a lot of nice things done with it. The girl is geniuely threatening, the stalking dynamic is explored. If it was a girl, everyone would be worried, but here Scott gets shouts of "You're not so special !" when he starts telling people about what happens. Everyone condomes Bess's behavior and no one really gets how self-destructive this is. Then comes the twist, and it manages to keep all the strengths of the movie and add no weakness. The ending for the side-characters is suitably moving and cute, and everything in the main plot is gruesome and mysterious enough, even though you wouldn't know that untill you watch it for the 2 first acts.
It's a bit different from the typical horror movie these days. I actually liked it a lot and found the story genuinely suspenseful.

This is a Great movie. Its just a good movie until that wonderful twist that made it great. Very much worth the watch. I had never heard of this movie and decided to give it a try, boy am I glad we did. The kids and I had a ball. Oh my kids are all in college and grad school. This is not a movie for younger kids. I watching with your kids I would say start at age 17.
I liked it okay, but I have seen better movies along the same line as this one. Wish it had a better plot.

If you've seen the 90's Silverstone movie "The Crush", you might think like I did upon reading the title that this was some sort of remake.  Well it's not, though it's the same premise; psychotic crushes.  While the theme isn't original, "Crush" is executed in a surprising and refreshing new way.  I also got some new insights on a few things that I thought I'd share, namely:

- Running is hazardous to your health, so just say no to running
- Cell phones are not idiot proof
- Bangs are back in style for summer
- Bicycle abuse is rampant, we need legislation to stop these atrocities perpetrated against our two wheeled friends
- And last and most important, the stalker of your stalker is your friend :)
It has a great twist.  I really enjoy a movie that keeps me guessing. You think you know what's going on & then you find out you have no clue:)

Well-done horror flick with characters who have brains, some that are somewhat askew. Pleasant twists and surprises that keep the interest going. This review is after my first viewing. I'd watch again with friends. Not for kids.
I rented this to watch during an airplane ride. It was much better than I expected. I wouldn't be surprised if this becomes a cult classic as people become aware of it.

In a movie intended to keep the audience guessing who the killer is until the end, putting her photo on the box cover really lessens the suspense.  I guess the box graphics people don't talk with the plot people!

CRUSH explores the oft-used theme of a predatory female terrorizing the popular high school jock.  Methodically paced and apparently predictable, CRUSH pulls a whopper of a 180 and pulls the biggest I GOTCHA in modern horror cinema.
The moment before this deception occurred, I told my wife "I wonder..." and kaboom, I was right.  That twist did demonstrate the writer's cleverness in working his audience and makes CRUSH a tidy little thriller.  Lucas Till brings a sense of honor to a usually clich role; Crystal Reed has a disturbing edginess as mousy Bess and Sarah Bol;ger displays both sexiness and naivete in her role of Till's true love.
CRUSH manipulates the viewer quite shamelessly and sets a new standard for cinema stalkers.
Don't want to give to much away, but I liked the way the movie ended. A little open ended, but plenty of room for interpretation.

I was very surprised at how much I enjoyed this movie. I rented it thinking I'd kill a little time with a goofy slasher flick, but instead Crush caught me completely off guard: it's that rare suspense flick (not quite a horror film) which deals with/ is aimed at young adults but takes its time in creating interesting characters instead of just rushing headlong to some cheap payoff.

The structure and really all of the plot elements will be very familiar to any fan of the genre- but "Crush" is elevated by crisp direction and pacing, a very good score, fine and even nuanced acting by all of the leads, (especially the actress who plays Bess; no matter how desperate and bizarre her behavior seems to get, you never stop feeling empathy for her) and a screenplay that genuinely strives to create real people.
There's just no laziness here: it's obvious that everyone involved truly cared about this movie and how it turned out.

I'm not saying this is a masterpiece of cinema by any stretch, and they don't quite stick the landing at the end- but this has to be the best "teenage crush turns deadly" movie ever.

Highly recommended. 4.25 stars out 5.

The movie is boring.  The plot isn't original.  It's about a girl who has a crush on a soccer player who doesn't return her feelings then bad things start to happen to his friends.  What made the movie a snoozer for us is there isn't any suspense.  The tormenting of the friends is very mild compared to other movies in the genre.  His friends open their curtains to find writing on their window stating "He's Mine".  Ohh then his girlfriend's nude pic gets sent to everyone in school.  And the most frightening is when his iPhone gets dropped in the swimming pool.

The twist ending where the stalker isn't who you think she/he is didn't do much to redeem the movie.  I would recommend a rental as opposed to purchasing it outright.  If you want a "fatal attraction"/crush gone wrong movie I would recommend Fatal Attraction or Crush (staring Alicia Silverstone).  Fatal Attraction and Crush (with Alicia Silverstone) are older movies but they are well done and suspensefull.  Yes, a bit precictable but if it is well done then it will suck you in and you won't care.
This was a very good movie as far as predictability. I was pretty much surprised by time the plot unfolded. I enjoyed it.

The ending is the worst. But the rest of the movie is not that bad. The whole movie they try to keep you guessing what is happening and what is going on, but they cant find a way to get you intensely involved with the story line. If you are the type of person that loves a thriller movie to sink into your skin and have your mind guessing....then don't waste your money on this movie. This is more the type of movie to watch when you cant find anything else to watch and you want to find something to pass the time. Or you should show this movie to tweens in high-school to show them what a bad example of crushing looks like haha

I really loved a great deal about this movie and I still think it's very worthwhile.  However, there is a flaw that prevented it from becoming a small cult classic.  They try way too hard to keep the audience off balance.  I never thought I would call that a flaw.  This is a very rare instance where they should have kept the plot slightly more derivative and stuck with the formula.  I won't give spoilers.  I kept thinking through the first half of the movie how much better it seemed than impressions I formed from reading reviews.  It's just that a certain moment arrives in the movie and it simply changes the atmosphere, not because it was implausible, but because it simply tried too hard.  Twists and surprises are great.  Sometimes too many spoil the strength of the punch line.  Too much of a good thing.  It's like when I made this girl I liked in college two cheesecakes for her birthday.  I was completely genuine, the cheesecakes were awesome, but sometimes it's just too much and you can guess the effect.

THE GOOD: With that out of the way, I want to say how much this movie really had going for it.  Crystal Reed is very, very good as the creepy quiet girl with the crush.  Yet in the fantasy scene where she imagines herself with confidence, the transformation is astounding and she is so gorgeous and nice it's heartbreaking.  It's just a fleeting glimpse for the audience to see what could be, yet is not real.  Lucas Till as the object of her desire is also terrific.  The temptation to turn him into such an adonis that the audience secretly hates him was thankfully avoided.  He is appropriately handsome enough to attract a fanatic admirer, athletic yet still very sympathetic.  He is a good guy.  I have loved Sarah Bolger ever since I saw her in Tudors and she definitely isn't a disappointment in this movie.  All the performances were spot on and deserve all the praise that can be given.  Still, Crystal Reed as the primary is really the one that sells it.  The characters and plot are really well fleshed out and would have carried the movie, without that one or two extra twists I mentioned.  I really thought the music soundtrack to this movie was great too.  All in all a terrific movie with much to recommend it.

THE PLOT (no spoilers):  It starts simple enough that I don't have to give a lot of details.  A high school soccer star attracts a ardent admirer (some would say stocker).  But this young man also has a very beautiful and popular female friend who is trying really hard to be more than just a friend. The popular girl becomes an obvious rival and obstruction to the admirer from afar.  Further complicating the situation is a hot high school teacher who also has a thing for the young soccer star and the audience is not entirely sure whether he will ignore her inappropriate attention.  Things get out of hand when someone mysteriously begins to dismantle the lives of all the women with any connection to him.

Go into this movie with a realization that it won't be perfect and you may like it a lot.  You might want to rent it first.
I read over a few reviews, and decided to watch the movie anyway!  I really enjoyed it, and was completely surprised by the ending!  Definitely recommend!

You will never expect the ending!!!  I thought this was a good take on the traditional crush genre movies.  Great acting and the story definitely kept you interested.  Just when you thought you have it figured out...you really don't.
It was interesting until they threw in an implausible plot twist. Dont waste your money. I would wait until it comes on cable to watch when there is absolutely nothing else on television.

What might have been yet another low-rent teenager-gone-berserk chiller turns out instead to have been created with considerable skill in the writing, acting, cinematography, and direction.  The story also has a topical "sexting" angle, as it includes an embarrassing photo sent around maliciously to everyone in the school - an issue that has been much in the news lately.  Both the story and the actor's characterizations show some real depth.  I was especially impressed by the work of Lucas Till (of whom the director said "the camera loves him") and Crystal Reed. Director Malik Bader makes the story flow fluidly and seamlessly, creating an atmosphere of foreboding and claustrophobia throughout.  Best of all, the film's cinematographer shot the movie with the Red One camera (I think it is the camera I spotted in the "Making of..." documentary), which makes for flawless, detailed, deep, and beautiful pictures.  It looks splendid on Blu-ray.  I shall be on the lookout for the next work from these talented folks.

Cross between Fatal Attraction and Misery (or Swim Fan and Misery) about a lonely teen outcast who has a painful crush on a hunky soccer player in her class.  She leaves him notes and follows him, watching from a distance and does other mildly creepy things.  But then bad things start happening to people close to the athlete.  Since they never show the perpetrator's face when any of the violent stuff happens it's pretty clear that there's going to be a twist--but it ends up working anyway.  After a genuinely chilling opening scene this is pretty slow until the last 30 minutes or so, but after it finally does pick up a little steam Crush turns into an entertaining thriller.

I wasn't sure what to think about this movie because some of the reviews weren't the best. Of course the story has been done before, but the twist at the end of this movie is what seperates it from the others. I was not expecting it at all. The acting was great too. I would recommend it to my friends and family.

I picked up the movie because I haven't seen a good psycho killer movie in a while. I wasn't expecting much from it but was actually intrigued during the entire film. If this movie would have been released to the theaters, I think it would have done very well just by word of mouth. It was presented very well for a low budget movie an also had solid acting. I have seen films featuring Lucas Till and have been impressed with the way he delivers his characters. I think he is someone who is going to have very good career with movies. I don't want to give anything away from the film, so I will leave my review at this.

Scott had it all until a sports injury crippled him during senior year. Now, he has to balance rehabilitation with friends, schoolwork, and a mysterious new crush, whose obsession with him threatens to destroy everything! From the very beginning, CRUSH plays into the same tired old cliches that frequent the thriller genre, first by introducing us to a group of well-groomed but utterly predictable teen stereotypes who make few attempts to gain our support. Lucas Till takes on the role of the pretty boy athlete against Crystal Reed's oddball loner, whose strange behavior leaves no room for ambiguity in the first and second acts. Right when it seems that everything has been figured out, however, writer Sonny Mallhi and director Malik Bader throw us for an unexpected loop that few will see coming. Some may say that the twist ending is a cheap cop out with insufficient clues, but at least it makes for a nice surprise. Although it is lacking in many regards, CRUSH travels at a brisk pace and offers a decent enough cast to carry the audience through to completion.

-Carl Manes
I Like Horror Movies
great
Good Movie Amazing Plot Twist I Nor Anyone Who Watched This Saw Coming
A CLASSIC REMAKE BUT WITH A NEW TWIST!
Good movie
Holy crap.... I love this movie! I expected it to b good but not this good lol! Definitely put a new plot to the fatal attraction genre!
Fantastic!

Good movie! Took a strange turn I didn't expect but had a good ending. Reminded me of my crushes in school only I wasn't that bad. One of my crushes I ended up living with 30 years after getting out of school! So I finally got him! I'd still be with him now but he passed away last year. R.I.P. my love...
Yo this movie is crazy. It kept my attention pretty well. A very good movie to rent if you're looking for a decent thriller with a young cast.
holy shit awesome movie
So I came for Lucas Till and Crystal Reed... Who knew I would stay for the movie? It was a surprisingly well written and suspenseful ride and I am glad I took the time to watch it!
